alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 3:08AM MST until December 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...MAJOR WINTER STORM STARTING TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. North of Spokane, total snow accumulations between 10 and 16 inches possible. South of Spokane, Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. East of SR-195 including US-95, total snow of 4 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho. Portions of Northeast and Southeast Washington. * WHEN...From late this evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The Wednesday morning and evening commutes will be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Occasional light snow will fall during the day ahead of the heavy snow that will arrive Tuesday night into Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse; Northern Panhandle
